timeline.body: so what will happen when `val` is null and `toFlatten == true` ? It will NPE on `val.toString()`. What should be the expected result ? We also need a unit test for this.
timeline.bodyText: so what will happen when val is null and toFlatten == true ? It will NPE on val.toString(). What should be the expected result ? We also need a unit test for this.
timeline.bodyHTML: so what will happen when val is null and toFlatten == true ? It will NPE on val.toString(). What should be the expected result ? We also need a unit test for this.
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: We added an additional conditional as well as an automation test for the null case.
replies.author: ashuka24

timeline.body: so `\u0002` is a separator of data within the struct value ?
timeline.bodyText: so \u0002 is a separator of data within the struct value ?
timeline.bodyHTML: so \u0002 is a separator of data within the struct value ?
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: Yes, I found this value by debugging a live session containing a nested struct. Further nesting would result in larger numbers, ex: \u0003 signifies a separation of data nested further down the struct.
replies.author: ashuka24

timeline.body: Why do we need to escape the string using java rules? can we add a comment why we are doing this?
timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to escape the string using java rules? can we add a comment why we are doing this?
timeline.bodyHTML: Why do we need to escape the string using java rules? can we add a comment why we are doing this?
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML: 👍 +1 for adding this class
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML:
i don't think it matters , but just to make it accurate, can we change the indexes here:

Suggested change
columnDescriptors.add(new ColumnDescriptor("name", DataType.TEXT.getOID(), 1, "text", null));
columnDescriptors.add(new ColumnDescriptor("amt", DataType.FLOAT8.getOID(), 3, "float8", null));
columnDescriptors.add(new ColumnDescriptor("name", DataType.TEXT.getOID(), 0, "text", null));
columnDescriptors.add(new ColumnDescriptor("amt", DataType.FLOAT8.getOID(), 1, "float8", null));
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.body:
can we remove the comment? 
```suggestion
        context.setMetadata(new HiveMetadata(properties, null, hiveIndexes));
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
can we remove the comment?

Suggested change
context.setMetadata(new HiveMetadata(properties, null /*List<HivePartition>*/, hiveIndexes));
context.setMetadata(new HiveMetadata(properties, null, hiveIndexes));
timeline.author: frankgh

replies.bodyText: I have the comment there for clarity. It is mostly to show that HiveMetadata requires a list of HivePartitions, but for these test cases this list is not necessary.
replies.author: ashuka24

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertThat(output.get(0).toString(), is("plain string\u00011000"));
assertThat(output.get(0).toString()).isEqualTo("plain string\u00011000"));
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.body: aren't we expecting two `OneField`s since we have two columns?
timeline.bodyText: aren't we expecting two OneFields since we have two columns?
timeline.bodyHTML: aren't we expecting two OneFields since we have two columns?
timeline.author: frankgh
frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertThat(output.get(0).toString(), is("a really \"fancy\" string? *wink*\u00011000"));
assertThat(output.get(0).toString()).isEqualTo("a really \"fancy\" string? *wink*\u00011000"));
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.body: again, here shouldn't we expect two `OneField`s in the resulting list?
timeline.bodyText: again, here shouldn't we expect two OneFields in the resulting list?
timeline.bodyHTML: again, here shouldn't we expect two OneFields in the resulting list?
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
columnDescriptors.add(new ColumnDescriptor("address", DataType.TEXT.getOID(), 3, "struct", null));
columnDescriptors.add(new ColumnDescriptor("address", DataType.TEXT.getOID(), 0, "struct", null));
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertThat(output.get(0).toString(), is("{\"street\":\"plain string\",\"zipcode\":1001}"));
assertThat(output.get(0).toString()).isEqualTo("{\"street\":\"plain string\",\"zipcode\":1001}"));
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertThat(output.get(0).toString(), is("{\"street\":\"a really \\\"fancy\\\" string\",\"zipcode\":1001}"));
assertThat(output.get(0).toString()).isEqualTo("{\"street\":\"a really \\\"fancy\\\" string\",\"zipcode\":1001}"));
timeline.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertThat(output.get(0).toString(), is("{\"line1\":{\"number\":1000,\"street_name\":\"a really \\\"fancy\\\" string\"},\"line2\":{\"city\":\"plain string\",\"zipcode\":1001}}"));
assertThat(output.get(0).toString()).isEqualTo("{\"line1\":{\"number\":1000,\"street_name\":\"a really \\\"fancy\\\" string\"},\"line2\":{\"city\":\"plain string\",\"zipcode\":1001}}"));
timeline.author: frankgh
